Speaker: killer
Dialogue: God loves me.

Speaker: killer
Dialogue: But I don't think he's too fond of you...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: ...And that's not football.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Football -- American football -- is a game for faggots.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Can I help you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I'm here...  No, it was nothing.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What makes you think we're here to meet you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Who else would you be?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Perhaps the police?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I know cops -- and you're no cop.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Cigarette?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: He trusts you to lock up?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Let's just say he knows who I am.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Anybody wanna tell me what we're waiting for?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: The question isn't what we're waiting for... it's who.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: And who the fuck is that?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Whoever hired us.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I got this gig through a contractor. And he most definitely didn't know who was doing the hiring, only that they were paying a lot of money...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: So none of us knows who's paying the freight, this is just some anonymous job. For all we know, we're working for different people.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Now that is an interesting proposition.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: How so?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Because if there's more than one party involved, if we really are working for different people, then perhaps some of us are on different sides.  Your orders might be different from mine.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: What're you talking about, man?  I don't understand.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: What a surprise...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I got a surprise for you, blondie...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Why don't both of you shut up?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Knock it off!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: The point remains: we could be working for different people.  There's a chance for one of us...  ...unpleasantness.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Anybody tries to unpleasant me I'll put two between his eyes -- one to do the job and the other to make sure it takes.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: It's good to see you've all got such faith in our little undertaking.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Who the fuck are you?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: The name is Deirdre, and I'm running this show.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Who are you?  IRA?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Not likely.  Once, yeah, I was -- but there wasn't an inch of profit in it, and I'm a cash oriented girl, if you take my meaning.  I'm a hired gun, same as the rest of you, and that's all any of us needs to know about the other.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: From here on in you want something you pay cash for it: no credit cards, no bank accounts are in place: ten percent up front, the rest when the job is done.  You.  What do you do and what should we call you?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: These days they they call me Gregor -- and I'm a tech.  I do electronic work, surveillance, computer runs.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sam.  I'm a weapons guy.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You were a soldier, were you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Once.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I drive -- and my name is Larry.  Larry from the States.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: And who are you?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'm Vincent.  And I coordinate.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Coordinate what?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Things.  This is my country, you know.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Are we in sync on this, Vincent?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: They call me Swede.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Who's they?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Everybody.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: And what is it you do?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Me?  I kill.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You shoot alright.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Gets the job done.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: All in the stomach, though.  Your man might live.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Not for long.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Long enough to shoot back.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's been known to happen.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Why don't you go do better, then...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Yeah, well...  My way works too.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: My way is better.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: It's quite satifactory.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Good, because it cost enough.  There's cheaper phones by far than that one, man: you better fucking use it.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I intend to.  This phone is wired like no other: it's got an encryption chip and instant sat-a-link recognition, it can talk to any computer in any language and make it understand.  With my custom hardware and this phone I can trace the target's cell phone signature and follow him anywhere he goes...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You sure about this?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I'd stake my reputation.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: But would you stake your life, that's the question...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: In this business, your life and your reputation are more often than not one and the same.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: You should watch what you eat.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Who the fuck died and appointed you food czar?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: I'm just worried about your health, Larry.  You could stand to shed a few pounds.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: And you could stand to get a little smarter, ain't that right you dumb blonde fuck?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Who you calling dumb, dickless?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Next one of you fuckers plays this game I'm going to do for you myself.  I won't say it again: we don't have time for this shit!  There's a clock running on this job, gentlemen, and I mean to be on schedule.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Let's go for a ride.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Where to?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: To see a man about a thing.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I can do that.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: Who gave you permission to park here?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's he saying?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Pretty much what you'd expect.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's what I thought.

Speaker: leader
Dialogue: There's a charge for parking on our block.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: He says this is their block.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: As in, they own it?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Something like that...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: And I suppose he's saying that we oughta give them something for using it, huh?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I didn't know that you spoke French.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't.  But the language he's speaking is universal.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: If you think we should.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Let me give you a hand.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What'd you say to him?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I asked if we could give him anything else.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: That was a nice move you did on our young friend.  Judo?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Jujitsu.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Same thing, isn't it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Not at all.  Similar, but not the same.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What's the difference?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: One's a lot more painful than the other.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Help yourself.  Since when do you smoke?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I have, I don't know, maybe a cigarette a week.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: A cigarette?  As in one?  One cigarette a week, who smokes like that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Christ, I smoke a pack-and-a-half a day, and I tell myself I could be worse.  It's just so damned pleasurable.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Course, you get cancer and die, that's the down side.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: There is that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: So, Vincent: why bring me along for the ride?  Job like this calls for a warm body, somebody who can stand around and look threatening.  A tough guy.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Like Larry or Swede.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Exactly.  Why not bring them?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Let's just say I thought the conversational possibilities were limited.  Of course, I might have brought Gregor, but he didn't seem like the right candidate -- for this.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Watch that one, he's an ex-spook for sure, maybe Stasi, maybe KGB.  He's smart, Gregor is.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: So is the woman.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Deirdre?  Smart, yeah, and seriously goddamned dangerous.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I wonder if she truly left the IRA.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I've wondered that myself.  None of this answers my question, though...  Why bring me?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I wanted to see who you were.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Who am I?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You were once some kind of special forces.  Airborne Ranger, maybe a Navy SEAL.  After that you rode shotgun for the CIA in some place like El Salvador or Afghanistan, a real mercenary.  Only now -- now you're like the rest of us, it's a very competitive market since the end of the cold war.  There's a lot of hired guns out here, and not nearly enough work to go around.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's right: there's not hardly enough work these days, nothing that pays the big money, anyhow.  Then along comes this job, paying so much goddamned money I couldn't afford not to take it.  Somebody's paying through the nose for this.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: They certainly are.  Whatever it is we're going to steal, it must be quite something.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Whatever it is it must be goddamned priceless.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Lovely, isn't it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They'd have to keep something like this under lock and key in New York, and it would still get fucked up.

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: That's good right where you are, Vincent.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Do you have it?

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: Not so fast.  Who's that?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: He's company.

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: Bad company...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: He's a cop, Vincent, he's French and he's a cop and you better shoot him in the fucking head right now!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I just wanted to see something.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: See what?

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: He wanted to see how you reacted when I said that you were a cop.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You told him I was a cop?

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: He asked me to say it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: He asked you to?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I needed to know.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You need to know a lot of shit, Vincent.

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: Are you ready?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Here's yours.

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: There's been a slight problem.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: If you say a word in English, Vincent, my friend with the high powered sporting rifle will shoot you in the throat. Sorry to screw you over like this, but the information you want might get me killed if I give it to you, and that's a price I'm not willing to pay.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I take it you still want the money...

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Where's my information?

Speaker: francois
Dialogue: In here...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Then you better find it in your heart to tell me, Francois, because while your death is inevitable, it still isn't decided how painful it's going to be.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Now would be a good time to get the fuck out of here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You know, what you pulled back there, that was bullshit.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I needed to see if you were a cop.  I hate cops...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Well I ain't a cop.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: How did you know?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Know what?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: That there was a gun pointed at me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I saw you look off when Francois nodded his head.  I figured he wasn't pointing out a particularly rare shrub, and the rest was easy.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: But how did you know I would have the presence of mind to pull my weapon when I did?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Because that's what I would have done...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You saved my life back there in the park. I know this doesn't begin to make it right between us...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What I did back in the park I did because we're working together -- we're on the same team.  This is business -- this is work.  We did it together, we share the spoils, even split.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I owe you a heavy debt.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Whatever you say.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: We kept it...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hazard pay...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: The two of you were supposed to go to a simple meet and come back with a simple piece of information, and instead you went to fucking war...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We weren't real thrilled about it either...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: So what's the deal?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: The deal?  The deal is we leave for Nice at first light.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: What'd you guys do?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I feel as if I've wandered onto the set of Enter The Dragon.  Could you teach me to do that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I didn't think to see you again tonight. You were pretty pissed.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I still am.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Part of me says I should just look at this as a perk.  You know, a bonus.  But then I remember you're you -- Deirdre who used to belong to the IRA -- and it occurs to me that deceit and subterfuge come very naturally to you.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Nobody's saying they don't.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: And when I consider that, I have to wonder if you don't have some ulterior motive for being here, with me, right now.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I probably do.  But for the time being, I'm willing to forget about it...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I would imagine that the great satisfaction in all of this will be killing the American.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: I hadn't thought about it.  Understand me, Gregor -- I take no pleasure in killing.  It doesn't bother me one bit, but I don't get off on it.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: A means to an end, is that it?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: That's it.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Then I guess we're set.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: There is one other thing...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Don't cross me...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Nobody's going to do that!

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I need you, Swede, I can't do this without you!

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: I just wanted to make sure you knew who you were dealing with.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I do, I do...

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Just remember it, then.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Look, Sam, don't take it the wrong way when I tell you we won't be doing this again.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You don't have to explain yourself to me, Deirdre.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: But I look at you and I get this feeling you take me for what I am: no more, no less.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You're a hired gun, Deirdre -- just like me.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Exactly.  And last night I wanted to be with someone who was just like me.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I better be getting that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Duty calls?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Just business.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Now then, let's run through it one more time, shall we?  What's your job?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I use my cell phone to get computer access to the telecommunications satellite used by our target.  I trace his cell phone signature and use it to pin point his location as he moves through Nice, relaying that information to you.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Next.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: You call me with the target's route, I follow along until we've reached the attack point and then I run his squag ass off the road.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Which leads us to...

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: I ride with fat-boy...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Eat shit and die slowly...

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: After we stop the target car I get out and use the heavy artillery to kill the driver and his bodyguard.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I blast the lead car into oblivion...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: While Sam and I take out the back two cars...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Leaving...

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: ...Leaving me to step in, drop the target in the back seat, and get the package...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: While...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ...While I back him up, making sure to get the package if something goes wrong and somebody takes Swede down.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Nobody's taking me anywhere...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: And then...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Then Swede and I split with the package and meet you back at the rendezvous.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: And then...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: And then Sam, you and I clean up whatever's left to be cleaned.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Very good.  Now all we have to do is live long enough to get paid.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Alright, Gregor, I'm...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Ready when you are...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Where is this broad?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: You should learn a little patience.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: It's consider a virtue in some corners of the world.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Not in mine.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You want to take a left, then, so that you're going west.

Speaker: the target
Dialogue: Fuck you!

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Not today.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: I don't particularly like killing, tubby, but I want you to know that this one I'm going to enjoy.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: He just...I don't believe that son-of- a...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: We've been crossed...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's a cocktail.  Mostly demerol, cut with a little crank because we might need you awake in the real near future.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Fine with fucking me, we got work to do. I don't care what it takes, we are getting our property back and putting it into the hands of the people who are gonna pay us a great deal of money when we do.  I don't know about the rest of you guys, but I'm not the kind of guy to just sit back and take it in the ass.  I don't mean that in, like, a literal way...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Finding this package is a thing easier said than done.  We don't even know what it is.  What did we steal?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: When this whole thing started you made it clear: you're running the show.  And I don't believe you'd be running this show if you didn't know what was going on.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Well I don't!

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: And I don't believe you...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You go shoot me if you want, Vincent, but you'll be dead before I hit the ground.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I don't want you dead, woman, I want the the truth!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ...put your guns down and chill out.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Like it or now, we're on the same side: we're here and the package isn't.  You're not the boss any more, you're our partner.  So tell us what you know, so we can figure a way out of this mess.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Now, what did we steal?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: But I do know who we're working for.  My people, and the Russian mob.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Your people?  Who the fuck is your people?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Who do you think, Larry?  The IRA.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: And you believed me?  But it wasn't my people who did it.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: How do we know that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Because if they had she'd be gone along with the package, instead of sitting here with us.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Exactly.  Gregor, he was the Russian's man.  It was my people came up with the idea for this run, but the Russians who had the capital to finance it.  Gregor, he was their insurance, and I was ours. Everybody else was supposed to be neutral.  Gregor must've got to Swede...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I never did trust that blonde fuck...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: That's why you were riding with him.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: The question still remains: what do we do now?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Gregor's cell phone...

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: What are you gonna do, call him up and ask him to give us back our shit?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Did he bring that with him?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I bought it for him -- all the stuff he was using, it was in his contract.  Cost a nice penny, too, especially that goddamned phone: Gregor had expensive tastes.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Check this out.  Gregor's a spook, or he was one until recently.  When he was a spy he lived the life -- you know, a prince in some Eastern Bloc country where nobody had shit and Gregor had everything.  Then the wall goes down.  No more Cold War.  And Gregor is out of a job.  No apartment, no special stores with Western food and video tapes.  I would bet dollars against shit that Gregor liked that phone and he doesn't want to give it up.  And I wouldn't be surprised if he's arrogant enough to think...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: That we're too stupid to trace his calls.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: It's a beautiful street, no?

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: Do you have it?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Always in a rush, you are.  All these years I've known you, you could never wait for anything.

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: This is important.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Do you really think so?

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: You know it is.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Relax!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Look over there.

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: What are you doing, have you lost your mind?!?

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: Why did you do that?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: To make a point.  I don't know her, and I was ready to splatter her brains all over the sidewalk.  I don't particularly like you, so imagine what I'll do if you try anything...

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: Enough!  We've been driving for an hour, where is my package?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: It's under your seat.

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: As my American friend Larry would say: are you fucking deaf?  It's under your seat.

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: I can't believe you'd do that, Gregor.  I thought I trained you better than that.

Speaker: dapper gent
Dialogue: I've never particularly liked you either, Gregor.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: It's done.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Much to your disappointment, no doubt.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I'm in the middle of saving you people a great deal of money -- the least you could do is have the decency to pay me!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: What I do is none of your concern.  What you should do is wait for my next phone call.  I'm going to find a place where I can tilt the field in my favor.  When I'm ready, I'll call you and tell you what I want you to do.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You weren't around when I woke up, I thought maybe something had happened.  Including you...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I came up here to sneak a smoke.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You were smoking?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I hope you don't mind I took your pack. It was on the table.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Please, help yourself.  Smoke as many you'd like.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I borrowed that, too...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Of course...whenever you feel like it just help yourself.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I have a feeling I'm about to start buying my own.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It was at that.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: A lot of people died.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I've seen a lot of people die before.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I haven't.  Not like that.  How do you get used to it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You don't.  You just learn to live with it.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I won't lie -- there have been times when I had to do it, times when the only way to get out alive was to see that the other man didn't.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We live in a singular world, my friend.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I never really thought I was part of the world you move in, Sam, to tell you the truth.  I'm a hood, a thief.  Big time in a small time king of way.  To the local police I'm a prize, to the local hoods I'm a legend.  But to a guy like you I'm just another two bit hired gun.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You might be a hired gun, Vincent, but I got a feeling you cost more than two bits.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Christ, I was starting to think that the two of you had thrown it in and walked away.  There's someone on the phone downstairs asking for you, and my somewhat limited French leads me to believe that he might have something to tell us about Gregor.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: That I could be dead and I'd drive better than you.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Oh shut up...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: He's going north.  That's Aix en Provence, where he used the phone.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: He's going back.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Not necessarily.  He could go off road at any number of places.  He might not even be in the country anymore.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's Paris.  The route's too indirect for anything else.  A guy like Gregor, he doesn't waste time on this road unless he has to be on it in the first place. Otherwise, he'd be out of the country by now.  He's going to Paris.  Now I just hope we can find him before he gets there.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: If somebody else doesn't find him first.

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: Opera?  This is an opera festival?

Speaker: mom
Dialogue: I told you that, Henry.

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: I thought you meant Phantom of the Opera. You know, Andrew Lloyd Weber, Cats, that kind of thing.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: This...this is incredible. Is the rest of Europe like this?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Some places, not all.  Italy, for instance, they're serious about their food.  But try bloody Britain, anywhere in the U.K., you don't get much fancier than a deep-fried bar egg.  Food's not our thing, you see.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: What is?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Best beer in the world known to man or God.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Best beer in the world?  Budweiser for me, thanks.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Budweiser?  You talk to me of beer and you've the unbridled gall to mention Budweiser in the same sentence?  That's not beer!  Christ, it's not even a poor excuse for rabbit piss.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: Oh yeah?  Whatta you drink, then?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I drink what every civilized man, woman and child in the world drinks: Guinness.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: ...but we've got to get back on the road.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: We've got him.

Speaker: larry
Dialogue: I'm driving.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I know those men.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Whatever you hear, whatever happens, when your partners come back out, you make sure you're here with the motor running.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Edvard, is that you?

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Yes, Gregor, they sent me.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I'm touched, really, that they'd send someone of your caliber.  It's nice to know that they didn't make the mistake of underestimating me twice.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: That was a mistake, trying to kill you. Mikhi did it without consulting me, I'd have never allowed it.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I'm sure.  But I'm sorry to say that it's too late for trust: we have a serious problem.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: We'll double your price.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Really?  Do you have the money with you?

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Do you have the material?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: You first, Edvard.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Perhaps we could both go at the same time...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: After you...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You might have been one mean technical spook, Gregor, but you wouldn't have lasted a week in the field.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Gregor, are you alright?

Speaker: deidre
Dialogue: ...but I think you're in a bit of trouble.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't talk to me unless you tell me what I want to hear, understand?!?  You have no choice in this, don't think about winning, think about staying alive.  I want the item, and if you don't give it to me, I'm gonna kill you.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I don't have it with me...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Bullshit!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I swear...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Then where is it?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I sent it to myself in Paris.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sent it where?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: A post office box.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Do you know who he is?  He's with Interpol, the Internation Police.  He's a cop.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You're a cop...you're a fucking cop...I should kill you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: But you can't.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: If you want to live you'll do exactly as I tell you.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Where do I know you from?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Vienna.

Speaker: edvard
Dialogue: Of course...I remember.  I quite liked you, I'm sorry to have to do this.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Cold cocking the poor son-of-a-bitch would have sufficed, Seamus, don't you think?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: That double-crossing bitch.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: That makes twice now you've saved my life.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I didn't save your life back there. Risked it, maybe -- but I didn't save shit.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You see it your way, I'll see it mine. You need a doctor.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You know one around here?  Somebody you trust?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: No...I thought I'd take you to the hospital.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No hospitals.  I'll fix this myself if I have to.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You're a cop.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Not exactly.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You're with Interpol -- you're a cop.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: If I was a cop, a real cop, I'd have busted you a long time ago.  This isn't about you, it's about the job I have to do.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: And what job is that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: My job, Vincent, a job you don't need to know about.  I can't go to the local cops -- they'd never be able to get close enough at this point.  It's me or nobody, and I've been on this job too goddamned long not to finish.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: It looks to me like we're all that's left of our group.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We?  There is no we in my world now, Vincent, just me.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'm going with you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: This doesn't involve you, don't you understand?  I can't even guarantee you any money out of all this.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: It isn't about money for me, not anymore.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You don't have to do this.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Yes I do.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: When we're done with this, I want to do for that one myself.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Now there's the Deirdre I know.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: And what's that supposed to mean, Seamus Reilly?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: It means I was worried that all the time you spent away from the fold might have affected you.  You've been living the life of the hired gun -- the well paid hired gun, I might note.  There's no glory to it, but there are those that like it.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: So you thought that maybe I'd grown too attached to this charade I've been playing, is that it?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: It's been known to happen.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Not to me, you know that.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: I thought I did.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I guess you don't know me, then, if you think I won't kill you for an insult like that!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Just testing, lass.  Forgive me, but I had to do it.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Remember what we agreed on, Seamus: when we get home, I don't play "the girl" again.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Hello, Jean-Pierre.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: American.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: It's right there, beneath the surface.  I can just make it out.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Alright, let's do it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Douse the wound with alcohol.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Take that sponge and wipe away as much of the blood as you can, keep it clean so I can see.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Take the clamp...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Peel back the skin and attach the clamp.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Alright, it's done.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You see the bullet?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Clearly.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Good.  Now take the forceps, and remember, Vincent, what we're doing here is routine.  I've done stuff like this at least twenty times in the field.  There are no vital organs where you're working, no major muscles or arteries -- you can't kill me.  Just make sure you've got the bullet before you try to pull it out.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: A souvenir...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You think you can stitch me up on you own?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Then if you don't mind...  I'm gonna pass out.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Yes, Sam's tough alright.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Of course.  Don't you?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Not exactly.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: How did you know?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Some, thanks.  Enough to move on, for now.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Soon.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It gets done now or not at all.  Another couple of days and the parties concerned are gone where I can't get them.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Vincent told you that I'm a cop?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: So this is what, a test?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: If I was healthy, I could take that away from you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: So what is it you want to know?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Created?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Vincent's life is his own burden; he'll have to carry it for himself.  And I'm not any kind of Samurai.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: A Samurai has honor, a Samurai live by the code of Bushido, the way of the warrior.  I'm just a killer for hire.  The world isn't about honor, anymore. It's about survival.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Where's the case?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: There's a problem...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Problem my ass!  I think you're lying to me, and if you are you're a dead man!

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Would somebody tell me what fucking well happened in there?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: The package didn't come.  I'm sure it will tomorrow.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: If you're lying to me you poor excuse for a human being, I'm gonna blow your brains all over this car.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I swear, it has to come here!  It has to...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Ease up, man...I'm just checking to make sure you're on the level.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: And it seems to me I saw a sign in there that says they got a late afternoon delivery.  Why don't we come back later today and do this all over again, huh?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Hey, man, they're both great movies.  One is more of a character study, the other is more of a straight action thing, but they're great movies, and he's an amazing fucking filmmaker.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Excuse me...

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: My man, how you doing?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'm alright.  And you?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Doing well.  This is?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: A friend.  I was telling him about how you always have the latest tapes.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Why don't we step into my office...

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: So what can I do for you?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I was wondering if you had any movies that were particularly new.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Matter of face there's this flick I've been hearing about.  I haven't seen it, but from what I hear it's pretty cool.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's the story?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: It's an international thing.  Several different peoples involved, criminals from all over the world, experts brought together to do a job.  But maybe the most interesting thing about it is that preeminent in the plot we find the Russian Mob and the IRA in bed together. An unlikely group of partners.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Do you have the tape?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: I might know where you could get a copy.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Let me do some business with my boy here, and I'll meet you across the street in five.  I gotta make homes here feel like he's getting a good deal while I give him the pleasure of overpaying me for a couple of second generation pirates.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: What I've heard so far, it's all a lot of talk.  I wasn't so sure what to make of it at first, cause, like I said, the Irish and the Russians are an unlikely mix.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You said you might know where we can get a copy of this tape?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: All depends on whether you want the Russian or the Gaelic language version.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Gaelic.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: You sure?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm sure.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Can you get it?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: The Russian would be easier.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Why's that?

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Cause the Russian production company would be easier to find.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's the Irish tape we want.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Gonna be tough.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Last I heard there was a film rep for the Irish players staying at this address, name of Seamus Reilly.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Seamus Reilly.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You know him?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I know of him.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Seamus Reilly, boy's a serious Irish Auteur -- a real firebrand.  Thinks his more moderate filmmaking brethren have turned to making movies for peace-loving pussies, if you see what I'm saying.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I get the picture.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Tony and I have to talk some business, first.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: I gotta try and overcharge him, he has to moan about the price, we settle somewhere in the middle.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: It's a matter of respect.  Why don't you wait outside, this won't take long.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: The Irish representative?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: The address of the Russian production company.  Just in case we need to find them.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thorough man.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You sure your friend got the right place?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: If Tony says this is it, then it's it.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Tell me, Sam: why do you do this?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Do what?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Continue when it would be so much easier to give it up.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's my job.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Then quit.  You don't work for Interpol, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sure I do.  You heard him, you heard the guy -- that's what he said, what Edvard said.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: It's a cover, then.  A cover within a cover, a feint within a feint.  You work for the CIA, it's the only possible answer.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm a field agent -- last of an already extinct breed.  I do dark ops.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Dark ops?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Dark operations.  Wet work.  Kidnaping. Assassination.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Very ugly.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It is at that.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Not very zen of you, huh?  Not so much the modern Samurai after all.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I never made that claim.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I know.  Jean-Pierre did.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You were behind the door?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I was waiting to see what would happen. I didn't want to kill him if I didn't have to.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You would have done that?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I would have tried not to.  But yes, if it would have kept him from shooting you, I would have.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How could you have done that?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Because I owe you.  Look at that...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They don't have the package.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You think?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You said it yourself: Gregor's not dead. If they had the package, they'd have killed him.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't do it...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Well, if it isn't Mr. Interpol himself.  I can't believe I misjudged you like I did.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Oh please..you're on some sort of holy mission?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I'm a patriate.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't even think that I'm buying that.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Where do you get off saying word one? All the time pretending to be one of us, it's the same thing we were doing, Seamus and myself.  And here you are so high and mighty, like you're so different from the rest of us.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I didn't say I was.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Bloody fucking hell...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't even think it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'd kill you before you had it halfway out.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What the fuck happened?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You don't know?  Bullshit, you had her, there was no way out.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: What in bloody hell is going on?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: They're part of the team.  One of them's the guy I told you about.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: From Interpol?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: That's him.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Why didn't you kill her?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Why didn't you kill him?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You slept with her!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: How is it these fellahs managed to get the drop on us?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I told you: they're good...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You slept with her!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: You should have kill him when you had the chance.  But no...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You put everything on the line because you...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: You slept with the fucker!!

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Left left left!!!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: This better be the real thing or you're a dead man!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: It is, I'm telling you it is!!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: You've told me a lot of things, boyo...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Lose them!

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You lose them!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: To the right!!!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Give me a cigarette.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Right now?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Gimme a goddamn cigarette!!!!

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You're not French, you don't live here, you don't know these roads.  Why are you driving?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: About time!

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Not yet...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Good Christ!  Can't you lose these jokers?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: They're good!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Nice place.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'm not here very much.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Business keeps you on the road?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Something like that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I know I don't need to say this to you, but I need to say it to you.  This is my job, I have to do it.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: So I do it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No you don't, and you know it.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: If our positions were reversed, would you leave me?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: In a minute.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I think not.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Do we need anything else?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah.  We need out fucking heads examined.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You better be careful, Seamus, before something happens a plastic surgeon can't fix.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: You think I'm going to fix this, Deirdre lass?  It's the mark of the patriot, and I'll wear it like a badge.  As for those who done it to me, I'll take my pound of flesh before this is all over.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You're thinking with your gun, Seamus, and not your head...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Shut up and drive!  I'm your superior officer and you will do as I goddamn well say, is that understood?!?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Do I need to repeat myself?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: No, Seamus.  I heard you the first time.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Not here.  They might see it.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: If I'm going to die for the CIA, I'm going to go out smoking.  Besides, there's half a forest between us and them, they can't see a goddamned thing.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Time to quit.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Just like that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Not just like that... Just before I turn around and it's six months from now and the first thing I do when I wake up in the morning is light a cigarette.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Samurai pain in the ass.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Would you stop with that...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Why?  You've got more force of will than anyone I've ever seen.  You handle a gun like it's a part of you, you perform surgery on yourself without anesthesia...  And most amazing of all, you quit smoking, just like that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What I do for the Company, Vincent, is no different than what you do.  We're both hired guns, and this is a job -- like any other job.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Why then, Sam, don't you act like this is a job like any other?  Surely, if you are a hired gun, you realize that some times you just have to walk away without getting what you came for.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Because I don't walk away.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's the one thing I've got left to hold onto.  Jean-Pierre is one of your closest friends, is he not?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Closest and oldest.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: And yet you would have killed him to save my life.  You have a sense of honor, Vincent, that I can't even remember anymore.  I don't know that I ever even had it to begin with.  All I know to do, Vincent, is to finish my job.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: And when you finish?  What then?  This package, whatever it is, do you give it to the CIA?  Do you really think they deserve it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's a good question.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Do you have a good answer?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No, I don't.

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: Would you like one?

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Since I won't speak your language, and you can't speak mine, English will do nicely.

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: This has all been a terrible mistake, Gregor.  I wanted to play straight with you, but Edvard insisted we try and kill you.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Edvard said the same thing about you before he died.

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: I'm shocked, shocked to think that you'd believe him.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Enough!

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: Ahh...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: What is he doing here?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: What am I doing here?  Why, I'm here to see my partners, Gregor, the boys in the Russian Mafia.  See, your bosses had hoped to screw me by hiring you to pull your thieving double cross.  But they only just found out that what's in the briefcase is completely useless without me.  I can't fight them, and they can't kill me -- that means we're gonna have to do business together.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: But you hate each other!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: What's a little hate between business partners?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm on point, Vincent.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: So, you've got it all figured, do you?

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Figured enough to know there's an odd man out and I'm looking at him.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I think not.  I have, of course, taken the precaution of wiring the briefcase to explode five seconds after it opens.  Unless, of course, I deactivate it before it goes off.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: That fucking figures...

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Should any of you decide to rush me, I'll kill myself and whoever happens to be near me at the time.

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: And more importantly --

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: I'll destroy whatever's in the case.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: It looks, Gentlemen, as if we're gonna have to sit down to table and work out an agreement.

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: That's one less I owe you...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: You two stay here and watch our mutual interest.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Let's work our way through the building. I'll take one wing, you take the other.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Watch your back, Vincent.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: I can't take it anymore.  Watch him, man, I'm going out and finish what needs finishing!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Go on, them...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Let it go, Sam, walk away.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: God damn it!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: We'll die if we stay here!

Speaker: mikhi
Dialogue: You'll die if you leave here.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You have to stop doing that!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'll work on it...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: It's you...  You're the one did this to my face, are you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's me.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Have a nice afterlife.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Deirdre, do for him, woman, put a fucking bullet in his head!

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Do it, for Christ's sake, do it so we can find that stinking Gregor, he's got the bloody package!  For God's sake, you're a soldier...

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: You're one of us...You been born and bred with your own people, you can't go against your nature.  C'mon, girl, I'm you're people.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I'm no girl, Seamus...

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: And you ain't nobody's people.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Let's get him out of here...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Finish the job...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: And now...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Finish it!

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Sam...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'm really sick of you saving my life.  Go out and get the bastard.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: He's got the briefcase rigged to explode five seconds after anybody other than himself tries to open it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Deirdre, wait up --

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: You might have made a good field agent you arrogant American prick, but you're not smart enough to go up against me.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Go ahead, shoot... Shoot and kill the bitch, I don't care.  And yet you don't shoot.  Interesting. Put down your weapon and walk away.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Don't do it, Sam!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: He'll kill me anway, Sam, shoot though me and kill this fucker.

Speaker: seamus
Dialogue: Shoot that traitorous bitch and I'll let you live.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Are you alright?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Alright?  It's bloody fucking freezing in here!

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: I need to speak with that man.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I can't allow that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Call that number and ask them what you should do.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: You can see your friend, now.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thank you very much.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: The field dressing you put on saved his life.  Where di you learn to do that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Here and there, I guess.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You son-of-a-bitch...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You speak French.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What of it?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Nothing...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: "Your field dressing saved his life." That's three I owe you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You don't owe me a goddamned thing, Vincent, and you know it.  You stepped in front of a bullet for me.  I owe you a heavy debt.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You better get some sleep, alright?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Tell me something first.  The package: what was it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't know.  Nobody knows, except a bunch of people who are too dead to tell us.  There's probably a couple of guys back at the Company who know, but I don't think they plan to tell me anytime soon.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What happened to it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Gone.  Destroyed.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I guess that's for the best.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Sam, when Gregor had Deirdre by the lake, you could have killed the two of them with one shot.  You could have had the package, finished the job.  But you didn't, you sacrificed the job to save her life.  Why?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's what you would have done.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I told you, I quit.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Just to keep me company, Sam -- I hate smoking alone.  How about you?  I thought all you IRA types smoked.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Only the stupid ones.  Cigarettes kill more patriots than bullets.  Besides, I'm not IRA no more.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: So where do you go from here?

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: I don't know.  I was thinking...Maybe the three of us might partner up -- guns for hire, that sort of thing.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'm up for that...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Not me.  You work too often with the same people and you become friends -- clouds your judgement.

Speaker: deirdre
Dialogue: Come off it, Sam -- if we weren't friends already we wouldn't be here now, would we?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: She's got a point.  Besides, I know of a job that's available.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How much does it pay?

Speaker: punk
Dialogue: This is for Seamus!

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: We have to go, Sam, we can't be here.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Let's go!!

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Doctor's orders...
